Package org.jtrim2.concurrent.query

Interface AsyncDataListener<DataType>

Type Parameters:
DataType - the type of the data provided by the AsyncDataLink. This type is strongly recommended to be immutable or effectively immutable.
public interface AsyncDataListener<DataType>
Listens for data provided by an AsyncDataLink.

Data is actually submitted to this listener by calling the onDataArrive(DataType) method. This method may be called multiple times subsequently to provide more and more accurate datas. Once there will be no more datas provided the onDoneReceive(AsyncReport) method must be called with the appropriate status.

Thread safety

Implementations of this interface are not required to be safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • AsyncDataLink
  • AsyncHelper

  • Method Details

    • onDataArrive

      void onDataArrive(DataType data)
      Invoked when data is available or more detailed information is available.

      This method may invoked repeatedly with more and more detailed data until the final and complete data is available. The general rule for the data to be provided to this method is that any previously reported data may be discarded safely because the new data is at least as accurate as the previous one.

      Once the final data was reported to this method the onDoneReceive method must be called to notify this listener that no more data will be provided.

      Note that this method must not be called concurrently twice for the same listener as listener implementations are not expected to be thread-safe. Also this method may only be invoked before the onDoneReceive has been called. That is every invocation of this method happen-before, the invocation of the onDoneReceive method of the same data request.

      Parameters:
      data - the data provided by the AsyncDataLink. This argument can only be null if the underlying AsyncDataLink implementations allows sending null data objects. However, allowing sending null data objects is not recommended.

    • onDoneReceive

      void onDoneReceive(AsyncReport report)
      Invoked after the last data was forwarded to the onDataArrive method. This method must be called exactly once per data request.

      This method must be called under every circumstances, even if the requested data could not have been provided completely (e.g.: it was canceled).

      Note that this method must only be called after every onDataArrive method invocation has returned and must not be called concurrently with such method invocation.

      Parameters:
      report - the AsyncReport object describing the state querying the data finished. That is, the exception if it could not be completed successfully due to an error and if querying the data was canceled before completion. This argument cannot be null.
